intro: Heliotropium ramosissimum var. trichocarpum, commonly known as the hairy heliotrope, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and also bear a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This species is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
